Set columns to be aligned to the center

Source: R/modify_columns.R
cols_align_center.Rd

Set columns to be aligned to the center

cols_align_center(data, columns)

Arguments

data

a table object that is created using the gt() function.
columns

a vector of column names for which the alignment should be applied.

Value

an object of class gt_tbl.

See also

Other column modification functions: cols_align_left, cols_align_right, cols_align, cols_hide, cols_label, cols_merge_range, cols_merge_uncert, cols_merge, cols_move_to_end, cols_move_to_start, cols_move, cols_split_delim

Examples

# Create a table object using the
# `mtcars` dataset and center align
# the `drat` column
gt_tbl <-
  gt(mtcars, rownames_to_stub = TRUE) %>%
    cols_align_center(columns = vars(drat))
